page.title: 08THE FLYING BOAT.
page.content: Mr.& Mrs. Taylor, who came from Lyndhurst, have run this Inn for 2\ years. They have two children aged 12 & 18. The one story building is 52 years old, its shape unaltered. Originally the officers mess of R.A.F. Calshot, the main bar was the ball room,the Empire Suite the dinning hall and the skittle alley was the corridor overlooking the Flying Boats. Six years ago the Inn was called The Owl and Crescent, the emblem of R.A.F. Calshot. The Taylors have three bedrooms, lounge, kitchen and bathroom in their living area. 18 full_time and 4 part_time workers are employed. It is a family establishment where children are welcome. Esso employees lunch there. The Empire Suite is hired out for private functions. Also regular discos and concerts are held with a late night bus service provided
